alert.note: Alert for Morgan (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 24 at 4:22PM MDT until July 24 at 7:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Morgan County in northeastern Colorado... * Until 730 PM MDT. * At 422 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.75 to 1.75 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fort Morgan, Brush, Log Lane Village, Hillrose, Snyder, Fort Morgan Airport and Union. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.75-1.75 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
